thread.title: Hollande SLAMS Trump after President claims terror attacks stopped friend visiting Paris
thread.title_full: Hollande SLAMS Trump after President claims terror attacks stopped friend visiting Paris

title: Hollande SLAMS Trump after President claims terror attacks stopped friend visiting Paris
text:
Hollande SLAMS Trump after President claims terror attacks stopped friend visiting Paris Hollande SLAMS Trump after President claims terror attacks stopped friend visiting Paris DONALD Trump has been blasted by the French president for claiming the former business tycoon’s friend “Jim” did not visit Paris because of Islamic terror attacks. PUBLISHED: 06:44, Sun, Feb 26, 2017 | UPDATED: 06:55, Sun, Feb 26, 2017 GETTY Francois Hollande has fired back at Trump's remarks 
Francois Hollande attacked the US President for his remarks and slammed Trump for his country’s gun control laws. 
Hollande said: “There is terrorism and we must fight it together. Related articles Douglas Carswell SLAMMED by his OWN PARTY amid calls to leave UKIP 
“I think that it is never good to show the smallest defiance toward an allied country. 
“I wouldn't do it with the United States and I'm urging the US president not to do it with France." 
He added: “I won't make comparisons but here, people don't have access to guns. GETTY Paris has seen a host of terror attack in recent months 
"Here, you don't have people with guns opening fire on the crowd simply for the satisfaction of causing drama and tragedy." 
Trump told the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) earlier this week that a “friend” said he would not visit France because of the spate of terror attacks on the nation. 
The Republican said: “Take a look at Nice and Paris. 
“I have a friend, he's a very, very substantial guy. He loves the City of Lights. He loves Paris. 
“For years, every year during the summer, he would go to Paris. GETTY Donald Trump has vowed to eradicate Islamic terrorism Paris? I don't go there anymore. Paris is no longer Paris 
“It was automatic with him and his family. Hadn't seen him in a while, and I said, 'Jim let me ask you a question: How's Paris doing?’” 
Trump quoted his friend as saying: “Paris? I don't go there anymore. Paris is no longer Paris.” 
It is not the first time the pair have tangled, as Hollande launched a scathing attack on Trump’s proposed plans to build a wall along the US border with Mexico. 
The French president has outlined his commitment to pulling EU member states together in a “rapid programme of integration”. Related articles
